events.text:
[i]As you take your first step into the switchboard room, you see nothing.Everything is dark.[/i]
[i]Pitch black. The last beam of light fades as Bobby closes the door behind you. You can barely see in front of you.[/i]

[Dream - Easy] [i]You need to get out of here *now*. There is nothing for you here.[/i]
[i]There is nothing for *anyone* here.[/i]
[i]Going in here was a mistake and there’s still time to turn around and leave before you see something you can’t unsee.[/i]

[i]Like a child trying to sneak past their parent’s bedroom in the middle of the night, not wanting to disturb whatever the silence is hiding.[/i]
[i]You slowly start walking towards the center of the room with your arm stretched in front of you, keeping your steps light so as to not make a sound.[/i]

[i]You feel something brush against your hand. Cold and metallic, it must be the cord to the room’s electric light.[/i]
[i]Your fingers wrap around the switch, and then you stop.[/i]

[Dream] [i]This is your last chance.[/i]
[i]Turn away now.[/i]
[i]You don’t need to know what’s in here.[/i]

[i]It’s too late now.[/i]
[i]You pull the string.[/i]
[i]The lights flicker on.[/i]

[i]The scene in front of you is a nightmare.[/i]
[i]Along the walls and on the floor are pools of blood, bathing the room in a charnel house scent.[/i]
[i]Papers littered across the floor lie stained with the splatter. Nothing moves, not even you, as the staleness of the room sets in.[/i]
[i]Across the room, slumped against the wall, is a lump, covered by a stained blanket.[/i]
[Dream - Easy] [i]You stare at it, almost like you expect it to move at any second, like it’s all some horrible prank just for you.[/i]

[Perception] [i]The stillness is broken when you notice something on the sheet.[/i]
[i]A small, black fly crawls along, looking for a way to get to the meat underneath.[/i]
[Logic] [i]The body has already begun decomposing, and the parasites have found a new space to feast and breed.[/i]

[i]You walk towards what was one of the building's operators. Someone you’ve passed by everyday you’ve been here.[/i]
[i]Their face is gone, replaced with white stained with red turning brown.[/i]
[i]You step in a puddle, creating the smallest of splashes, crimson now dripping from your boot.[/i]

events.question:
[i]You finally stop right in front of the shape.[/i]
[i]This bedsheet ghost that haunts this room. [/i]
[i]You reach out your hand to banish it, replace it with the person who belongs here.[/i]

events.text: [i][FAIL][/i]

[PASS] [i]You immediately jolt your hand back from the body.[/i]
[i]Your better judgment prevails: this is not something you need to take with you.[/i]
[i] You take a moment, breathe in the putrid air, and decide that the rest of the room warrants more investigation than the form beneath you.[/i]

[i]It’s too late to turn back. It became too late when you entered this room. Your hand clasps the sheet, feeling the soaked linen between your fingers.[/i]
[i]With a jerk, you pull it off.[/i]

events.question:
[i]This was a terrible mistake.[/i]
[i]This was a terrible mistake.[/i]
[i]This was a terrible mistake.[/i]

events.choice: [Composure - Hard] Try to keep it together

events.text:
[PASS] [i]You close your eyes.  Try to distance yourself from where you are.[/i]
[i]Forget about the blood on your hands. Forget about the body by your feet.[/i]
[i]Forget about the scent in your nose. Pretend you’re anywhere but here.[/i]

[i]You open your eyes. The body of Abe Long, one of the telegraph operators, is still there. [/i]
[i]You’re still in the switchboard room. But it’s different. The stillness is different. It’s calmer. [/i]
[i]Quieter.[/i]
[i]You turn away from the body.[/i]

[Perception - Hard] [i]But not before you see something. In the rigid right fist of the body, a piece of metal is jutting out.[/i]
[i]It’s a plug cord, important for connecting calls with the switchboard. A trickle of blood slides down the metal.[/i]
[i]You kneel, and after struggling against the rigor mortis, you yank the cord away from the corpse. [/i]
[i]Now it’s time to investigate the rest of the room.[/i]

[FAIL] [i]You try to wipe away the image, but it’s burned into your eyes. You try to forget about the blood, but you can feel it on your palms.[/i]
[i]You try to stop the rot, but its scent is all-consuming.[/i]
[i]You’re hyperventilating, taking in more of the filth with each breath.[/i]
[i]There is no end to this that you can see. The bile is rising to your throat. All you can do is let out a scream.[/i]

[i]You hear the door slam behind you. Bobby has come rushing in, obviously having heard you.[/i]
[i]He grabs hold of your shoulders.[/i]

Jesus, man! Do you want everyone to know about this? Just turn around and walk with me.
We’ll step away from all this, and I want you to take a breather, alright?

[i]You do as the man instructs, and walk closer to the door, trying to put as much distance between you and the remains as possible.[/i]
[i]Taking in some of the less spoiled air, you calm down enough to avoid hysteria.[/i]

*sigh* I know. It’s an ugly scene here.
 Poor bastard. Don’t know what drives someone to do that, let alone what they were thinking.
[Empathy - Hard] [i]There’s a softness in his voice. A moisture in his eyes. He’s been here before.[/i]
Who was it for you?
What?
You’ve seen this type of thing before. Who was it?
[i]He bristles under the question.[/i]
..Nobody. You just see things sometimes.
[i]That’s as much of an answer as you’re going to get, you assume.[/i]
You good? Not gonna freak out again?
[i]You nod. You should be fine now that the worst is over.[/i]
Alright. I’ll be outside. Hopefully no one else heard ya.

[i]He opens the door and just as quickly exits it, minimizing the time the room is exposed to those outside.You’re alone in here again. With it.[/i]
[i]Time to investigate.[/i]
